p: The contents of total phenolics, phenolic acids, flavonoids and flavonols were calculated by applying appropriate calibration curves and the results are presented in Table 1. For each test, the results were screened on three concentrations (0.1, 0.25 and 0.5 mg/mL) in order to make the obtained results comparable with DPPH assay. Moreover, by using different concentrations, the methods underwent a verification, since a concentration gradient for the vast majority of samples was found. Furthermore, only the results obtained at the concentration of 0.25 mg/mL will be considered for further discussion, since a dose dependency was observed for the phytochemical contents, meaning that with the increase of extract concentration, there is a higher amount of polyphenolics found in them.
